newsitem.title: HUNGARY: POSTABANK SEC MAINTAINS 'BUY' ON TVK .
newsitem.headline: POSTABANK SEC MAINTAINS 'BUY' ON TVK .

text.p: Hungary's Postabank Securities said it maintained its "buy" recommendation on shares in Hungarian chemicals firm Tiszai Vegyi Kombinat Rt saying its price did not reflect all positive conditions.

"Improving profitability, already started capacity expansion and the expected inflow of money related to its privatisation provide a strong base for the company's further development," analysts Ferenc Szollosi and Tamas Hargitai, said in a company research.
"We believe these favourable impacts have not yet been factored in the current price, therefore we continue to recommend the purchase of the shares," they said.
TVK is expected to cash in five billion forints under the provision of Hungary's previous privatisation law and an additional one billion forints of accumulated interest, they said.
Postabank Securities expects TVK's earnings per share (calculated with IAS figures) to rise to 455 forints in 1997 from 320 in 1996.
On the Budapest Stock Exchange TVK shares finished at 2,910 forints, up 45.
